default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
a {@item crossbow, light|Ishiir|light crossbow} and 20 {@item crossbow bolt|phb|bolts}
an {@item explorer's pack|phb} and {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}

entries.name: Multiclassing with Warlock
entries: If your blood hunter is part of the Order of the Profane Soul and also has warlock levels, add one-third of your blood hunter levels (rounded down) to your warlock level and consult the warlock progression table in the Player's Handbook for total spell slots, cantrips known, and spell slot level. You should consider aligning your otherworldly Patron feature between both classes, but your DM might allow you to have two different patrons at their discretion.

subclass.name: Order of the Ghostslayer
subclassFeatures: Blood Curse of the Exorcist|Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Ghostslayer|Ishiir|15

subclass.name: Order of the Profane Soul
subclassFeatures: Order of the Profane Soul|Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Profane Soul|Ishiir|3
Brand of the Sapping Scar|Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Profane Soul|Ishiir|11
Blood Curse of the Souleater|Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Profane Soul|Ishiir|18

subclass.name: Order of the Serpent
subclassFeatures: Blood Curse of the Adder's Kiss|Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Serpent|Ishiir|15

classFeature.name: Variant Hemocraft Ability Score
entries: As a blood hunter, you use your Intelligence modifier for some of your class and subclass features. However, with your DM's permission, you can choose to instead use your Wisdom modifier for all your blood hunter features that use your Intelligence modifier by default.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Bane
entries: You have survived the Hunter's Bane—a dangerous, long-guarded ritual that alters your life's blood, forever binding you to the darkness and honing your senses against it. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to track fey, fiends, or undead, as well as on Intelligence {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to recall information about such creatures.

The Hunter's Bane also empowers your body to control and shape hemocraft magic, using your own blood and life essence to fuel your abilities. Some of your features require your target to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to resist the feature's effects. The {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DC is calculated as follows:
Hemocraft save DC = 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Hemocraft modifier (your choice between Intelligence or Wisdom)

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict
entries: You gain the ability to channel—or sometimes sacrifice—a part of your vital essence to curse and manipulate creatures through hemocraft magic. You know one blood curse of your choice. A list of the available blood curses can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=BC|source=Ishiir} page. You learn one additional blood curse of your choice at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level. Each time you learn a new blood curse, you can also choose one of the blood curses you know and replace it with another blood curse.

Each time you use your Blood Maledict feature, you choose which curse to invoke from the curses you know. While invoking a blood curse, but before it affects the target, you can choose to amplify the curse by taking necrotic damage equal to one roll of your hemocraft die. This damage can't be reduced in any way. An amplified curse gains an additional effect, noted in the curse's description. Creatures that do not have blood are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to blood curses unless you have amplified the curse.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can use it again. You can use Blood Maledict twice between rests starting at 6th level, three times starting at 13th level, and four times starting at 17th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite
entries: You learn to invoke a rite of hemocraft that infuses your weapon strikes with elemental energy. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can activate any rite you know on one weapon you're holding. The effect of the rite lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. When you activate a rite, you take necrotic damage equal to one roll of your hemocraft die. This damage can't be reduced in any way.

While the rite is in effect, attacks you make with this weapon are magical, and deal extra damage equal to your hemocraft die of the type determined by the chosen rite. A weapon can hold only one active rite at a time. Other creatures can't gain the benefit of your rite.
You choose one rite from the crimson rites below when you first gain this feature. You learn an additional crimson rite at 7th level, and again at 14th level.

entries.name: Rite of the Flame
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is fire damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Frozen
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is cold damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Storm
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is lightning damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Dead
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is necrotic damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

entries.name: Rite of the Oracle
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is psychic damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

entries.name: Rite of the Roar
entries: The extra damage dealt by your rite is thunder damage. (Prerequisite: 14th level)

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order
entries: You commit to an order of blood hunters whose philosophy will guide you throughout your life: the Order of the Ghostslayer, the Order of the Lycan, the Order of the Mutant, or the Order of the Profane Soul, each of which is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 7th level and again at 11th, 15th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: You gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir} feature, you may choose it in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Brand of Castigation
entries: When you damage a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you can channel hemocraft magic to sear an arcane brand into that creature (no action required). You always know the direction to the branded creature as long as it's on the same plane as you. Further, each time the branded creature deals damage to you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you, the branded creature takes psychic damage equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of 1).

Your brand lasts until you dismiss it or until you use this feature to apply a brand to another creature. Your brand can be dispelled with {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir}, and is treated as a spell with a level equal to half your blood hunter level (maximum 9th level).

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} - or until you spend a use of your Blood Maledict to regain it.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: You can use your Blood Maledict feature twice between rests.

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite Improvement
entries: You gain an additional Crimson Rite.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Grim Psychometry
entries: You gain a supernatural talent for discerning the secrets surrounding mysterious relics or places touched by evil. Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check to recall information about the sinister or tragic history of an object you are touching or your current location, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the check. At the DM's discretion, a suitably high roll might cause your character to experience brief visions of the past connected to the object or location.

classFeature.name: Dark Augmentation
entries: The magic of hemocraft suffuses your body to permanently reinforce your resilience. Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 5 feet, and you have a bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Brand of Tethering
entries: The psychic damage from your Brand of Castigation increases to twice your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of 2). Additionally, a branded creature can't take the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action, and if it attempts to teleport or to leave its current plane by any means, it takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the attempt to teleport or leave the plane fails.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: You can use your Blood Maledict feature three times between rests.

classFeature.name: Hardened Soul
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite Improvement
entries: You gain an additional Crimson Rite.

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: You can use your Blood Maledict feature four times between rests.

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Sanguine Mastery
entries: Your mastery of blood magic reaches its height, mitigating your sacrifice and empowering your expertise. Once per turn, whenever a blood hunter feature requires you to roll a hemocraft die, you can reroll the die and use either roll.
Additionally, whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you regain one expended use of your Blood Maledict feature.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Ghostslayer
entries: The Order of the Ghostslayer is the oldest of the blood hunter orders, its members having originally rediscovered the secrets of hemocraft and refined them for combat against the scourge of undeath. Ghostslayers seek out and study the moment of death, obsessing over the mystery of the transition from life, and the unholy power that can cause the dead to rise once more. These zealous blood hunters make it their life's work to destroy the scourge of undeath wherever it is found, tuning their abilities to engage undead creatures and those who manipulate the necromancy that creates them.

subclassFeature.name: Rite of Dawn
entries: You learn the Rite of the Dawn as part of your Crimson Rite feature. When you activate the Rite of the Dawn, the extra damage dealt by your rite is radiant damage. Additionally, while that rite is active on your weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your weapon sheds bright light out to a range of 20 feet.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic damage.
When you hit an undead creature with a weapon for which the Rite of the Dawn is active, you roll an additional hemocraft die when determining the extra damage from the rite.

subclassFeature.name: Curse Specialist
entries: You learn to master blood curses. You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. In addition, your blood curses can target any creature, whether it has blood or not.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Walk
entries: At the start of your turn, you can magically step into the veil between the planes as long as you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, as well as see and affect creatures and objects on the Ethereal Plane. You take {@damage 1d10} force damage if you end your turn inside an object.

This feature lasts for one minute. If you are inside an object when it ends, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and you take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you moved.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} - or until you spend a use of your Blood Maledict to regain it. You can use Aether Walk twice between rests starting at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Sundering
entries: Your strikes expose a fragment of your foe's essence, leaving them vulnerable to your Crimson Rite feature.
Whenever you hit a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you roll an additional hemocraft die when determining the extra damage from the rite.

Additionally, if a branded creature has the Incorporeal Movement trait or a similar feature, it can't move through creatures or objects while branded and it cannot benefit from being {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist
entries: You hone your hemocraft to tear corruption from the minds and bodies of your allies—and to punish those responsible for it. You gain the Blood Curse of the Exorcist for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Revival
entries: You learn to protect your fading life by reabsorbing the energy you feed to your weapons. If you have one or more crimson rites active and you are reduced to 0 hit points but don't die outright, you can choose to have all your active crimson rites end and immediately regain hit points equal to twice your blood hunter level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Lycan
entries: The ancient curse of lycanthropy is feared by nearly all peoples and cultures, passed through blood and seeding a host with the savage strength and hunger for violence of a wicked beast. The Order of the Lycan is a proud group of blood hunters who undergo “the Taming”—the ceremonial infliction of lycanthropy by a senior member of the order, for those who do not already carry the curse before seeking this path. These hunters then use the magic of their blood to harness the power of the monster they harbor, without losing themselves to it. Using intense will and secret blood magic rituals, members of the Order of the Lycan learn to control and unleash their hybrid forms for short periods of time. Enhanced physical prowess, unnatural resilience, and razor-sharp claws make these warriors a terrible foe to any evil that crosses their path. Yet no training is perfect, and without care and complete focus, even the greatest of blood hunters can temporarily lose themselves to their own hunger.

entries.name: The Burden of Lycanthropy
entries: Those inducted into the Order of the Lycan choose this path with conviction, understanding the terrible weight it imposes on them and the challenges it brings. Where most afflicted by the curse of lycanthropy grow wicked, deranged, and even murderous, Lycan blood hunters accept the gifts of the beast while maintaining control through intense training and the power of their blood magic. A member of the Order of the Lycan cannot spread their curse through blood unless they wish to, and one of the most sacred oaths of this order is to never infect another creature without the order's sanction.

If a member of the Order of the Lycan is ever cured of their lycanthropic curse, it brings terrible shame to their name and the order. Members who have been cleansed against their will readily return to the order to undergo a renewed initiation of the Taming, reintroducing the curse to their bodies and restoring their honor.

Lycanthropy comes in many forms bound to specific beasts, with wolf, bear, tiger, boar, and rat the best-known variations. The particular strain of the lycanthropic curse defines the physical traits that manifest in a Lycan blood hunter's hybrid transformation, even as the benefits the curse bestows remain relatively uniform.

subclassFeature.name: Heightened Senses
entries: You gain the improved senses of a natural predator. You learn the {@skill Perception} skill or gain expertise in it if you already know it.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation
entries: You learn to control the lycanthropic curse that courses through your veins. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you transform into a special hybrid form for up to 1 hour. You can speak, use equipment, and wear armor while in this form, and can revert to your normal form as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. You automatically revert to your normal form if you fall unconscious or die.

This feature replaces the rules for lycanthropy in the Monster Manual. Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation Features
entries: While you are transformed, you gain the following benefits and drawbacks:

entries.name: Feral Might
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, and you have a +2 bonus to melee damage rolls. This bonus increases to +3 at 9th level and to +4 at 16th level.

entries.name: Resilient Hide
entries: While you are not wearing heavy armor, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level.

entries.name: Predatory Strikes
entries: You can apply your Crimson Rite feature to your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}, which you treat as one weapon. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes}, which deal {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice). This damage increases to {@damage 1d10} at 11th level and {@damage 1d12} at 17th level.

Additionally, when you use the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}, you can make one additional {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Prowess
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet, and you add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance. You also learn the {@skill stealth} skill or gain expertise in it if you already know it.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Transformation
entries: You learn to unleash and control more of the beast within. You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Your hybrid form also gains the following additional benefit.

entries.name: Lycan Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns when you have at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, you gain hit points equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). If you are in hybrid form, you gain these hit points before you must make the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} for your bloodlust.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Voracious
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} for your bloodlust while in hybrid form. Additionally, your Brand of Castigation can now bind a foe to your hunter's ferocity. While in your hybrid form, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against a creature branded by you.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation Mastery
entries: You have mastered your inner predator. You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature an unlimited number of times, and your hybrid form lasts until you revert to your normal form, fall {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}, or die.
You also gain the Blood Curse of the Howl for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Mutant
entries: The process of undertaking the Hunter's Bane ritual is a painful, scarring, and sometimes fatal experience. Those who survive are irrevocably changed—and not always for the better. Over generations of experimentation, a splinter order of blood hunters honed the way in which hemocraft alters the body, using corrupted alchemy and toxic elixirs to alter their blood even further. Over time, they have modified their capabilities in battle, becoming something beyond what they once were. Calling themselves the Order of the Mutant, these blood hunters now specialize in assessing the strengths and weaknesses of their foes, altering their biology to be best prepared for any conflict.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagencraft
entries: You learn to master forbidden alchemical formulas—known as mutagens—that can temporarily alter your mental and physical abilities.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you consume a mutagen, whose effects and side effects last until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} unless otherwise specified. While one or more mutagens are affecting you, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to focus and flush all mutagens from your system, ending their effects and side effects.

Mutagens are designed for the specific biology of the character who concocted them, and your mutagens have no effect on other creatures. They are also unstable by nature, losing their potency over time and becoming inert if not used before you finish your next {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Formulas
entries: The number of mutagens you can concoct when you finish a rest, and the number of formulas you know, increases as you gain levels in the blood hunter class, as shown on the Mutagencraft table above. Additionally, when you learn a new mutagen formula, you can replace one formula you already know with a new mutagen formula. You choose four mutagen formulas to learn from the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MF|source=Ishiir} page, and you can concoct one mutagen when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Metabolism
entries: Your body begins to adapt to toxins and venoms, ignoring their corrupting effects. You gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} condition.

Additionally, you can trigger a burst of adrenaline that lets you temporarily resist the negative effects of a mutagen. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can ignore the negative side effect of one mutagen affecting you for 1 minute. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Axiom
entries: Your mutagenic hemocraft lets your Brand of Castigation reveal a foe's true nature. Any illusion or invisibility in effect on a creature when you brand it ends, and the creature can't benefit from {@condition Invisible|Ishiir|invisibility} or illusion effects while branded by you. If a creature branded by you is in an alternative form (by way of the {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} spell, the Change Shape action or Shapechanger trait, the Wild Shape feature, and similar effects), it must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or revert to its true form and be {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. Whenever a branded creature attempts to alter its form, it must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have the attempt fail, and it is {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion
entries: Your blood curse can infuse a creature's body with terrible toxins. You gain the Blood Curse of Corrosion for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Mutation
entries: Your body has adapted to produce mutagens naturally in a moment of need. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, choose one mutagen currently affecting you. Its effects and side effects end, and you can immediately have a mutagen you know the formula for take effect in its place.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Profane Soul
entries: Blood hunters belonging to the Order of the Profane Soul have pushed the limits of hemocraft for use against some of the most terrifying creatures corrupting the world. Ancient fiends and cruel magic-users have long counted on their ability to meld into the background and escape those who hunt them, vanishing into noble courts without a trace, or bending the minds of the most stalwart warriors with but a glance. So the blood hunters who founded this order trusted to their resilience as they delved into the same well of corrupting arcane knowledge, making pacts with lesser evils to better combat the greater threats. And though they might have traded a part of themselves for their power, the members of this order know the benefits of that power far outweigh the price.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: You strike a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice:
The choice you make augments some of your subclass features, as noted below.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: You augment your combat techniques with the ability to cast spells. See chapter 10 of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 of the Player's Handbook for the warlock spell list.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 10th level, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Blood Hunter Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Blood Hunter Features table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

For example, when you are 8th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell Witch Bolt|Ishiir}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature.
You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Blood Hunter levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Blood Hunter Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Warlock spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the table. The chosen spells must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach level 7, for example, you learn a new Warlock spell, which can be of levels 1–2.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you gain a Blood Hunter level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Warlock spell of an eligible level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Your chosen Hemocraft ability (Intelligence or Wisdom) is your spellcasting ability for your Warlock spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus.
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB} as a Spellcasting Focus for your Warlock spells.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Focus
entries: Your weapon becomes a conduit for the power of your pact with your chosen patron. While you have an active crimson rite, you can use your weapon as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells, and you gain a specific benefit based on your chosen pact.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: Once on your turn, when you damage a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you can expend one use of your Blood Maledict to force the creature to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your hemocraft save DC. On a failure, the creature casts dim light in a 10 feet radius and cannot benefit from being {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. Additionally, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} for the duration.

entries.name: The Dragon
entries: When you activate your Crimson Rite, you can change the damage type of your rite to that associated with your draconic patron (as per the warlord dragon patron's Draconic Arcana feature). Additionally, you gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 10 ft.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} or as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} used to activate your Crimson Rite, you expend one use of your Blood Maledict feature to heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature regains a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die + your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: The Fathomless
entries: You can breathe underwater. Additionally, you suffer no {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on melee weapon attacks for fighting underwater and, once per turn when you damage a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you can reduce that creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: While using the Rite of the Flame, your hemocraft die increases by 1 step for the purposes of dealing damage with your weapon. Additionally, the damage from this rite ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.

entries.name: The Genie
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} or as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} used to activate your Crimson Rite, you expend a use of your Blood Maledict feature to give yourself a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet, which lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of 1 round).

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature, that creature and any other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of it are {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: When you attack a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite and the target is under a curse effect (such as the {@spell Hex|Ishiir} or {@spell Bane|Ishiir} spell or a blood curse), your crit range against that target increases by 1 step.

entries.name: The Kraken
entries: You can breathe underwater and suffer no {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on melee weapon attacks for fighting underwater. Additionally, you gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 30 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 30 feet.

entries.name: The Spider Queen
entries: Once on your turn, when you damage a creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you can expend one use of your Blood Maledict to force the creature to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your hemocraft save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. This feature ignores {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to the poisoned condition.

entries.name: The Raven Queen
entries: A shadowy spirit appears on your shoulder. The spirit assumes the form and game statistics of a raven, and it always obeys your commands, which you can give telepathically. The spirit disappears if it is more than 100 feet from you, but can be resummoned onto your shoulder as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} as long as your Crimson Rite is active. The spirit is incorporeal and cannot physically interact with anything except you. It is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to all damage and conditions.

While the raven is perched on your shoulder, you gain {@sense darkvision|Ishiir} with a range of 30 feet and a bonus to your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score and to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. The bonus equals your Hemocraft modifier.

entries.name: The Seeker
entries: When a creature you can see within 10 feet damages you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend one use of your Blood Maledict to deal radiant damage to the attacker. The damage equals one roll of your hemocraft die + your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: The Undead
entries: When you take necrotic damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to halve that damage. In addition, your appearance changes to reflect some aspect of your patron while you have any crimson rite active.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Your patron lets you choose from an expanded list of spells. When you gain access to a new pact magic spell level, you can select one of the options listed for your patron. You learn that spell and it does not count against the number of warlock spells you know.

entries.caption: Celestial Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Guardian of Faith|Ishiir}, {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Genie Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Evil and Good|Ishiir}, {@spell Sanctuary|Ishiir} (Dao), {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir} (Djinni), {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir} (Efreeti), {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir} (Marid)
{@spell Phantasmal Force|Ishiir}, {@spell Spike Growth|Ishiir} (Dao), {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} (Djinni), {@spell Scorching Ray|Ishiir} (Efreeti), {@spell Blur|Ishiir} (Marid)
{@spell Create Food and Water|Ishiir}, {@spell Meld into Stone|Ishiir} (Dao), {@spell Wind Wall|Ishiir} (Djinni), {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} (Efreeti), {@spell Sleet Storm|Ishiir} (Marid)
{@spell Phantasmal Killer|Ishiir}, {@spell Stone Shape|Ishiir} (Dao), {@spell Greater Invisibility|Ishiir} (Djinni), {@spell Fire Shield|Ishiir} (Efreeti), {@spell Control Water|Ishiir} (Marid)

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Frenzy
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of the attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Invocation
entries: You gain one eldritch invocation available to the warlock class. You cannot select an invocation for which you do not meet all prerequisites, including certain class features available only to the warlock class. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI|source=Ishiir} page.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can replace the invocation you know with another invocation that you could learn at that level. You use your levels in this class in place of warlock levels to determine whether you meet the prerequisites.
If an invocation allows you to {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}, you must have access to the appropriate spell level, even if the invocation does not require you to expend a spell slot to cast it.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Sapping Scar
entries: Your Brand of Castigation feature digs dark arcane scars into your target, leaving them vulnerable to your magic. A creature branded by you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against your warlock spells.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Eldritch Invocation
entries: You gain an additional eldritch invocation.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Souleater
entries: You learn to siphon the life energy from your fallen prey. You gain the Blood Curse of the Soul Eater for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Rite of the Viper
entries: You learn the Rite of the Viper as part of your Crimson Rite feature. When you activate the Rite of the Viper, the extra damage dealt by your rite is poison damage and weapons affected by it have their crit range increased by 1 and their reach increased by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Viper's Arsenal
entries: Your gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in {@skill Stealth} and the {@item Poisoner's Kit|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Serpent's Senses
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet and {@sense Blindsight} with a range of 10 feet. If you already possess either sense, its range increases by the same amount.

subclassFeature.name: Viper's Venom
entries: When you damage a creature with a weapon affected by your Rite of the Viper, it has to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your Hemocraft save DC. You can force a creature to make this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} only once per turn.
On a failure, a target is {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for 1 minute. It can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Adder's Kiss
entries: You gain the Blood Curse of the Adder's Kiss for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Serpent's Sway
entries: Your {@sense Blindsight} range increases by 10 feet. No attack from within your {@sense Blindsight} range has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against you as long as you are not {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.
